intro: Vincetoxicum vomitorum, commonly known as the vomiter's vine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with toxic properties. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit, heart-shaped leaves, and clusters of small, fragrant, white to greenish flowers. Its fruits are follicles that contain seeds, and the plant produces a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin. Vincetoxicum vomitorum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
